statement: D. Eternal Victorytime limit per test2 secondsmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstdinoutputstdoutValerian was captured by Shapur. The victory was such a great one that Shapur decided to carve a scene of Valerian's defeat on a mountain. So he had to find the best place to make his victory eternal!He decided to visit allncities of Persia to find the best available mountain, but after the recent war he was too tired and didn't want to traverse a lot. So he wanted to visit each of thesencities at least once with smallest possible traverse. Persian cities are connected with bidirectional roads. You can go from any city to any other one using these roads and there is a unique path between each two cities.All cities are numbered1ton. processed.result:
There are $n$ cities connected by bidirectional roads. Each road connects two cities and has a length.  You start in city 1 and need to visit each of the other cities exactly once.  Find the shortest total distance you need to travel to visit all the cities.

Input:

* The first line contains an integer $n$ (1 ≤ $n$ ≤ 10⁵) representing the number of cities.
* The next $n-1$ lines each contain three integers $x_i$, $y_i$, and $w_i$ (1 ≤ $x_i$, $y_i$ ≤ $n$, 0 ≤ $w_i$ ≤ 2 × 10⁴) representing a road between cities $x_i$ and $y_i$ with length $w_i$.

Output:

* A single integer representing the shortest total distance to visit all cities.

You are given a list of roads connecting cities. Each road has a length.  You start at city 1 and need to visit every other city exactly once. What is the shortest total distance you can travel to do this?
